title.narrative: Pôle régional d'appui aux Cadres Stratégiques

description.narrative: Pôle régional d'appui aux Cadres Stratégiques de Lutte contre la Pauvreté

Le Pôle régional d'appui aux Cadres stratégiques de lutte contre la pauvreté (CSLP) est une initiative conjointe du PNUD et de la France et a fait l'objet d'un mémorandum d'accord en date du 4 septembre 2006.

1.3.1. Nombre de mecanismes nouveaux de partenariats avec des financements de solutions de gestion durable des ressources naturelles, des services des ecosystemes, des produits chimiques et des dechets au plan national et desagrege par type de partenariat au plan communautaire et du partenariat public-privé 1.3.2. Nombre d'emplois et d'amelioration des conditions de vie crees au profit des femmes à travers la gestion des ressources naturelles, des services des ecosystemes, des produits chimiques et des dechets, desagreges par sexe et en milieu rural et urbain dans les sites d'actions du projet Ecovillages 1.3.3. Nombre d'emplois et d'amelioration des conditions de vie crees au profit des hommes à travers la gestion des ressources naturelles, des services des ecosystemes, des produits chimiques et des dechets, desagreges par sexe et en milieu rural et urbain dans les sites d'actions du projet Ecovillages 1.3.4. Nombre d'emplois et d'amelioration des conditions de vie crees au profit des femmes et des hommes à travers la gestion des ressources naturelles, des services des ecosystemes, des produits chimiques et des dechets, desagreges par sexe et en milieu rural et urbain dans les sites d'actions du projet Ecovillages 1.3.5. Nombre de RNC/UP legalement etablis par deliberation pour utilisation durable des ressources biologiques 1.3.6. Nombre de chartes locales de bonne gestion elaborees, adoptes et en cours de mise en oeuvre dans les RNC/UP 1.3.7. Nombre de KM de pare-feux ouverts/nettoyés par contrat-plans 1.3.8. Nombre de ruches en cours de mise en production 1.3.9. Nombre de villages electrifies au solaire 1.3.10. Nombre de personnes formées au suivi, à l’entretien, la maintenance et la gestion des equipements solaires 1.3.11. Nombre de biodigesteurs construits et en cours de fonctionnement dans les menages ruraux 1.3.12. Nombre de foyers ameliores construits et en cours d’utilisation dans N foyers 1.3.13. Nombre d’Equivalents Tonnes de CO2 évitée (du fait du sol
To remove barriers to an integrated approach to sustainable natural resource management, biodiversity conservation and low carbon development in rural areas of Senegal through the Ecovillage model.

1. Carbon footprint (using Bilan Carbone method to calculate GHG emissions/ sequestration) from energy and land use at the level of village lands (terroir villageoise?)
(Indicator 9, below, is sub-set of this same Indicator)

comment.narrative:
Bilan Carbone baseline data exists for some test rural villages. [METHODOLOGICAL NOTE added in 2013:] At PRODOC preparation stage (PPG), the Bilan Carbone had been applied in full for 4 prospective eco-villages: (i) Teyel in Haute Casamance; (ii) Loumbol Samba Abdoul in the Ferlo; (iii) Diadeum 3 in the Delta du Fleuve SÃ©nÃ©gal; and (iv) Massarinko in the Delta du Saloum. Of these, only (ii) Loumbol and (iv) Massarinko ended up being finally selected as project sites. Through informed extrapolation and based on the results of the Bilan Carbone and other studies, a proxy baseline of for the GHG balance (i.e. emissions minus sequestration) was established in for a total of 4 out of 10 project sites, all of which are net emitters: Yearly GHG emission / carbon sequestration balance (tCO2):
[2] Toubel Baly 3,786
[4] Ndick 2,973
[7] Massarinko 6,345
[10] Thiasky 2,973 PPG technical reports also showed that the most important contributors to the net emissions in prospective ecovillages were the agricultural and livestock sectors, coupled with land use change.

1a) At start of project, the baseline and business-as-usual? (BAU) development scenario for comparison will be established (10 pilot villages). 1b) By project end, the application Bilan Carbone for 10 pilot Eco-villages shows that these villages have embarked on a low carbon development path: net emissions are at least 30% lower than the BAU development scenario. [NOTE on logframe revision: indicator revised to introduce clarity.]

Good progress towards the target which are reduction of 30% of CO2 emission in eco-villages. The estimation of the carbon balance in the Eco-villages is at around 148,532 t CO2 eq/year. After three years the level of reduction of carbon emissions is estimated at 42,566 t CO2 equivalent, which corresponds to 29% reduction compared to baseline.

description.narrative: 2. Number of Environmental Management Plans (EMPs) adopted by pilot sites

comment.narrative: No plans are yet developed
At least 8 plans for project sites have been successfully developed and adopted (endorsed) by communities At least two plans are under implementation

EMPs in the 11 core ecovillages are still under implementation. The 11 local conventions on good natural resource management developed last year, are now validated and under implementation. Actions of enrichment planting in CNR are still ongoing (100,000 Palmyra nuts introduced in CNR) The process of transfer of fauna is under finalization. Forest fire prevention measures are still implemented under actions such as fire breaks and forest management program (22 km of firebreaks)

description.narrative: 3. GEF Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool (METT): METT scores for existing and new CNRs show improvements in management and biodiversity conservation effectiveness

comment.narrative:
Baseline scores for 7 out of 8 CNRs (from PPG METT application in Aug 2010): [1] Diokoul Diawrigne
64
[2] Bounguien CNR
72
[3] Kak proposed CNR
33
[4] Mbawal proposed CNR
51
[5] Mansadala CNR
73
[6] Dindefelo CNR
t.b.d.
[7] Mansarinko CNR
73
[8] Gnargou Comm Forest
74
METT scores for all 8 project CNRs (2 new, 4 extended, 2 existing) show increases of at least 10% from baseline over 5 years and 20% for sites with starting score more than 60%
Project results regarding METT show an increase of 10% at least for ecovillages with a score <60%. It is the case in Kak and Dar Salam METT Score 2012 2014 Kak 33% 59% Dar Salam 47% 58%

description.narrative: Improved governance framework and capacity for the effective incorporation of biodiversity conservation and low carbon, adaptive development into the National Ecovillage Strategy
4. Inter-Ministerial Protocol established between Ministry of Ecovillages (MEBRLAP/ ANEV) and Ministry of Environment (MENP/ DPN; DEFCCS)

comment.narrative: No existing working relationship or agreements
4a) Signed and implemented inter-Ministerial protocol 4b) Effective working relationships at all levels, local to national

13 protocols signed and implemented :
2 with the departments of the Ministry in charge of the Environment (DEFCCS, DPN),
2 with the departments of the Ministry in charge of Energy (ASER PERACOP),
5 with the private sector (COSEER, CMA, Station Energy, SWF, Techogas) and
4 with non-Government actors (Vivre en brousse, ADEA, Industry sans frontrière, ADOS)

description.narrative:
5. Improved competence levels and standards of the institutions responsible for EVs (ANEV, DPN, DEF, GENSEN) measured by increased scores of the Capacity Development Scorecard
Average scores for all thematic areas (1 to 5 see below) and levels of capacity (systemic, institutional and individual) for both PA management and energy efficiency market transformation.
[Refer to PRODOC Annex 3 for a list of Capacity thematic areas and baseline scores]

comment.narrative:
Average scores for all thematic areas and capacity levels of capacity for both PA management and energy efficiency market transformation: ANEV 62%
DEFC 66%
GENSEN 76%
DPN 65% (see PRODOC Annex 3 for a complete and disaggregated analysis)
Average scores for all thematic areas and levels of capacity for both PA management and energy efficiency market transformation increase by at least 10% for each of the target institutions.

Results for all thematic areas and capacity levels for Protect Areas management and market transformation of energy efficiency increased by at least 5% for each of the target institutions such as ANEV, DEFCS, GENSEN, DPN. Furthermore, 30 training sessions were held from June 2014 to June 2015 in all core Ecovillages (i.e a minimum of 3 sessions of technical training in the Ecovillage Center) benefitting 952 people. Officers of the project have been trained in the techniques of carbon sequestration studies (inventories, assessment techniques on sequestration) and biodiversity conservation (Score METT).

description.narrative: Integrated land use, natural resource management and biodiversity conservation provide social benefits in pilot Ecovillages and contribute to global BD benefits in CNRs and adjacent PAs
6. New CNRs (2); extensions of existing CNRs (4) and existing CNRs (2) functioning to conserve global biodiversity within their boundaries and in adjacent PAs

comment.narrative:
Nationally:
21 CNRs, 27 UPs, (total 441,000 ha) designated* Among project sites:
6 CNRs tallying 147,013 ha (* See Table B in Section One of the METT for a non-exhaustive list of Community Natural Reserve and Pastoral Units in Annex 2.)

Among project sites at least 15,000 ha of new and extended Community Nature Reserves established and functioning to conserve biodiversity, increasing total conservation area targeted by the project to 162,813 ha Evidence of effective management is provided by increases in METT scores for all CNRs

Among the sites of the project, at least 28,875 ha of new and extended CNR established and operating to conserve biodiversity, increasing the total area targeted by the conservation project at 225,788 ha. Plants production is estimated at a total of 2,181,200 plants (500,000 plants in 2012; 632,463 plants in 2013, 1 048 737 plantsin 2014 and 1.148 million plants in 2015) against 2 million plants planned, a rate embodiment of 150%. Fruit plants represent 10% of total production. On the other hand, the forest inventories done show net biomass gains of 1.7 to 2.4 m3 per hectare per year. Is for 225,788 hectares of RNC, the equivalent of an average annual reforestation effort of 21,901,436 plants of more than 5 cm in diameter. Add to this the fact that 28 875 ha of new RNC adds enable sequestration of nearly 57,750 teq CO2 / year, or a 39% reduction of emission levels within ecovillages which is higher than the target which were 10%. As an alternative to poaching of wildlife in AP/CNRs, we report the following: - 150 units of family poultry farming with powerful breeds were provided to households and groups of women by partner NGO CIVD. - 8 incubators were installed for larger dissemination of poultry - 700 beehives introduced into the RNC for benefit of village ecoguards.

description.narrative: 7. New Ecological Perimeters established and providing village needs through sustainable management (wood fuel/ timber; endemic species for CNR rehabilitation, medicinal plants, bamboo)

comment.narrative:
7a) Nationally, only
4 or 5 EPs existed in 2009 (the concept is quite new)
7b) Among project sites:
2 established in project villages with up to 50ha
At least 200 ha of new EPs under sustainable management in all 10 villages [Text for the target had been accidently removed from 2013 PIR due to a pasting mistake. We add it back now.]

Within 10 Ecological perimeters was taken to a double vegetable cropping over a total area of nearly 70 ha. Added to this is the introduction of 6 storage magazine and improve vegetable cropping. Which has generated nearly 2,5 million FCFA / year or nearly 120,000 FCFA / household. In addition, we report that: - 98 micro-projects aiming at intensification of production / income generation are financed. - 40 ha of village woodlands are now established. - 150 eq ha of fruit trees - one ecotourism camping in lompoul - three fish ponds in Thiasky and one fish farm in Ndigue - 6 Agro food processing units -10 artisanal saponification units
- 10 artisanal bakery units

description.narrative:
8. BD Indicators in selected CNR/ PA:
Dindefelo: (8a) ha of chimpanzee habitat protected / managed (8b) PNNK/ Ferlo migration corridor conservation/ management

comment.narrative: 8a) Dindefelo 13,000 ha chimpanzee habitat (Wula-Nafa project) 8b) PNNK/ Ferlo Migration corridor exists on maps; little information on animal numbers / movements

Dindefelo Additional 7,000 ha chimpanzee habitat protected and managed as CNR (extension towards Guinea border) PNNK/ Ferlo Monitoring data on large mammal migration available to improve conservation and management of corridor

8a) Target achieved in the last reporting period. now we are implementing the EMP. In this regards the project support the Eco-guards. Regarding the 300 ha of area designated for the protection of Bamboo plantations in Dindefelo actions of conservation are ongoing 8a) Nothing to report this year.

description.narrative: Reduction in greenhouse gas emissions and increase in use of renewable and efficient energy alternatives in pilot Ecovillages
9. Carbon footprint (using Bilan Carbone method to calculate GHG emissions/ sequestration) from energy sector at the level of village lands (â€œterroir villageoisâ€?) (sub-set of Indicator 1)

comment.narrative: Bilan Carbone exist for some test rural villages; baseline needs to be established for all 10 project pilot villages at start of implementation

The carbon footprint for energy sector in 10 pilot Eco-villages are at least 30% lower than the business-as-usual? development scenario (based on the Bilan Carbone methodology) [NOTE on logframe revision: formulating of indicator target revised to introduce clarity.]
Increases in carbon assessment for the energy sector in 10 core EVs are at least 10% lower than the development scenario BAU. in 2015 the level of avoided carbon emission is 13,200 tCO2e

description.narrative: 10. Percentage of households in project EVs with an improved cook stove

comment.narrative: Baseline for all Project villages to be established at start of implementation
At least 75% of all households in the 10 pilot Ecovillages use improved cook stoves

Target achievement is now at 92%. Target was surpassed for 8 out of 10 Eco-villages, but not overall. [1] Lompoul 60%
[2] Toubel Baly 100%
[3] Kack 110%
[4] Ndick 100%
[5] Darsalam 100%
[6] Dindefelo 100%
[7] Massarinko100%
[8] Mbam 50%
[9] Mbackombel 100%
[10] Thiasky 100%
Overall 92% In addition with the 900 units of improved stove of banco one can add 900 metallic improved stove installed. That gives now an average of one banco stove and one metallic stove/household in core eco-villages and in some polarized eco-villages. We provided training and equipment to 10 teams in eco-villages for the dissemination of improved cook stoves. 95 biodigesters for cooking gas and lighting kitchens installed. The effluents produced are used to fertilize vegetable plots.
The introduction of improved stoves and biogas in order to improve cooking methods avoided deforestation equivalent of nearly 570 ha of forest. It also allowed the reduction of nearly 2 375 t eq CO2 of GHG emission.

description.narrative: 11. Quantity of Jatropha oil produced locally in project Evs

comment.narrative: 0 litres
10,000 litres / year of Jatropha oil is produced locally in the project Evs

There is progress towards target achievement in 2015 : - 300 kg of seeds already collected for the production of 100 of jatropha oil which represents 1% of the target - Linear planting of jatropha over 53 km and its cultivation on a surface area of 40 ha for oil production purposes

description.narrative: Increased biocarbon sequestration in Ecovillage community-managed lands (terroirs villageois)
12. Number of tons of CO2 sequestered in living hedges

comment.narrative: 12a) 0 km on new living hedges planted 12b) 0 tCO2 sequestered per year in living hedges

20km living hedges (40,000 trees) in 10 EVs (12a), giving C sequestration of 55 tCO2 per village/ year that is at least (12b) (Project total: 200km hedges (400,000 trees); 550 tCO2 sequestered per year)

12a) Target achieved by 40% 12b) The target achieved is 50% . 10 km of hedges (20,000 trees) in each of 10 core EV, allowing sequestration of 22.5 tonnes of CO2 per village / year
Regardind carbon sequestration, the total amount of living hedge allowed the sequestration of 275 eq t co2/year.

description.narrative: 13. Number of tons of CO2 sequestered in bamboo plantations

comment.narrative: 0 tons
20,000 bamboo plants in each of 4 project EVs, giving sequestration of at least 27 tCO2 per year per village (Project total: 80,000 bamboo plants; 108 tCO2 sequestered/ year)
10,000 bamboo plants in each of the 4 EV project, allowing sequestration of at least 13.5 tonnes of CO2 per year per village

description.narrative: 14. Number of tons of CO2 sequestered in mangroves

comment.narrative: 0 tons

250 ha (2.5M propagules) of mangroves planted in each of 2 project EVs; giving sequestration of 750 tCO2 sequestered / village/ year) (Project total: 500 ha (5M propagules) mangroves; 1,500 tCO2 sequestered/ year)
Close to achieving the target (at 96%). 240 hectares of mangroves planted. Which allows sequestration near 720 t CO2 eq/ year

description.narrative: 15. Number of hectares of soil improved through Biochar amendment

comment.narrative: 0 ha
10 ha soil improved in test plots (1 Ecovillage)
soil fertility of 5 ha improved using biochar and 380 ha using the compost

title.narrative: TRANSFERT TECHNOLOGIE - PRODUCTION MATERIAUX ISOLANTS TH

description.narrative: L'objectif du projet est de faciliter le développement d'une production locale de matériaux d'isolation thermique à base de Typha. Il vise à améliorer l'efficacité énergétique dans les techniques de construction en milieu urbain, comme en milieu rural.

L'objectif du projet est de faciliter le développement d'une production locale de matériaux d'isolation thermique à base de Typha. Il vise à améliorer l'efficacité énergétique dans les techniques de construction en milieu urbain, comme en milieu rural.

Facilitation of the transfer of the technology for producing an innovative thermal insulation material using bulrush (typha australis).

comment.narrative:
0
Investments are expected after the technical and commercial validation.
However the project made some investments related to the training materials of local artisans and demonstration insulating plates.

description.narrative: Number of local manufacturers of typha-based building materials by EOP

comment.narrative:
0
The Kaito partner identified in the current feasibility studies to build three industrial units: a unit of production of the raw material, a gypsum binder production unit in semi industrial blocks and production unit of insulating plates. Feasibility studies are in progress. The models have to be approved by the technical committee.

description.narrative: Secured supply of quality typha raw material ensuring large scale sustainable investment in the local production of typha-based building materials.
Number of companies involved in Typha large scale clean material harvesting by EOP

comment.narrative:
0
In collaboration with SEN environnement and KAITO, the project is still in the feasibility studies since the first results have demonstrated that it will be too expensive to have a complete industrial unit for harvesting, drying and processing. the process cannot be considered without all necessary treatment until appropriate fibers. In addition, adequate machinery for harvesting at large scale and consistent with the standard are being identified.

In addition to the first 5 groups, other groups have expressed their interest in harvesting as well.

title.narrative: PROJET EFFICACITE ENERGETIQUE DANS LE BATIMENT SENEGAL

description.narrative: Ce projet se concentre sur la réduction des émissions de GES au Sénégal à travers l'introduction de normes d'EE dans le secteur du bâtiment.

title.narrative: PIMS 4344 Senegal EE Prodoc version FRANCAISE_a signer

description.narrative: SENEGAL NATONAL ADAPTATION PLAN
Le système statistique national souffre encore de plusieurs contraintes. 5 agences du SNU se sont engagés à élaborer et à mettre en oeuvre le programme conjoint statistique

Aider gouvernement à améliorer la qualité des produits du système de statistiques national, à l'effet de disposer des données fiables pour la prise de décision, l'élaboration, la mise en oeuvre et le suivi-évaluation des politiques publiques
